title: SVSEM Tomography of Tubular Network Block Copolymers â€“ Observation of the Core Regions of Crystallographic Defects
content: Slice and view scanning electron microscopy (SVSEM) can reconstruct the intricate, interpenetrating 3D microdomain morphology of tubular network block copolymer phases such as the double diamond (DD) and double gyroid (DG) with high fidelity. Very large specimen volumes with respect to all three spatial dimensions can be reconstructed for detailed characterization of the mean and Gaussian curvatures of the intermaterial dividing surface (IMDS) between domains and also to provide quantitative analysis of distortions from processing and applied mechanical forces [1] and direct visualization of the core region of various types of crystallographic defects [2-4].
